revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = Eye of GNOME | logo = [[Image:Eog logo.svg|50px]] | screenshot = [[Image:Eye of Gnome 2.32.0 displaying a PNG file with alpha transparency.png|250px]] | caption = Eye of GNOME on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] | developer = GNOME developers | latest_release_version = 3.2.0 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2011|9|28}} | latest_preview_version = 3.1.1 | latest_preview_date = {{release date|2011|5|9}} | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = [[GNOME]] | genre = [[Image viewer]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = [http://www.gnome.org/projects/eog/ gnome.org/projects/eog] }}
'''Eye of GNOME''' ('''EOG''') is the official [[image viewer]] for the [[GNOME]] desktop environment. Unlike some other image viewers, Eye of GNOME will only display images. It does, however, provide basic effects for improved viewing, such as zooming, fullscreen, rotation, and transparent image background control.
== File formats ==
Eye of GNOME supports the following file formats:
* [[ANI (file format)|ANI]] â Animation * [[Windows and OS/2 bitmap|BMP]] â Windows Bitmap * [[Graphics Interchange Format]] (GIF) * [[ICO (icon image file format)|ICO]] â Windows Icon * [[JPEG]] â Joint Photographic Experts Group * [[PCX]] â PC Paintbrush * [[Portable Network Graphics]] (PNG) * [[Portable pixmap|PNM]] â Portable Anymap from the PPM Toolkit * RAS â [[SunOS|Sun]] Raster * [[Scalable Vector Graphics]] (SVG) * [[Truevision TGA|TGA]] â Targa * [[Tagged Image File Format]] (TIFF) * [[Wireless Application Protocol Bitmap Format]] (WBMP) * [[X BitMap]] (XBM) * [[X PixMap]] (XPM)
Eye of GNOME also supports the viewing of the [[Exchangeable_image_file_format|EXIF]]/XMP metadata associated with an image.
== Criticism == Eye of GNOME was criticized for its lack of GIF animation playback;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/idea/4580/ |title=Idea #4580: "Image Viewer (eye of gnome) doesn't handle animated .gif files."}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://bugs.launchpad.net/eog/+bug/35545|title=Bug #35545 in eog: "Doesn't display animated GIFs"}}</ref> however, this functionality was included in version 2.29.1.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/eog/2.29.1-0ubuntu1 |title=2.29.1-0ubuntu1 : âeogâ package : Ubuntu: |date=2009-11-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://git.gnome.org/browse/eog/commit/?id=a8133caa982f783c615eec8c8aa7eb6b0e5a9a95 |title=eog - Browse and rotate images, a8133caa982f783c615eec8c8aa7eb6b0e5a9a95}}</ref>
Also, it used to render SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) as a rasterized bitmap by default.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://brainstorm.ubuntu.com/idea/18167/ |title=Idea #18167: "eye of gnome doesn't render svg properly"}}</ref> This bitmap then gets manipulated when scaling the image, resulting in pixelation when zooming in.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bugs.launchpad.net/eog/+bug/92127 |title=Bug #92127 in eog: "SVG images look blurry when zoomed in"}}</ref> However, this is fixed since version 2.31.1.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mail.gnome.org/archives/gnome-announce-list/2010-May/msg00008.html|title=GNOME Announcement List: "Eye of GNOME 2.31.1"}}</ref>
